bow: taking two babies on plane by myself help suggestions of how to get through this without going insane please in one month am taking my girls months and 18 months old on 12 hour flight just saying that gives me anxiety have booked flight that leaves at 7pm figure this will give me time to get the toddler settled in and fed then *hopefully* she falls asleep for bulk of the time any tips for making it through this with my sanity in check get them their own seats for sure it safer and saner is that the correct word when took my 18 month old on flight brought bunch of small dollar store toys age appropriate that she had seen before would give her one at time when she was bored with one would swap them out also brought lots of snacks and her favorite blanket her having her own seat with her car seat in it was the best decision made though have good trip admire your bravery can barely take my 20mnth old to target without going insane ok my suggestion would be to put the month old in carrier the toddler in stroller and book bag on your back the stroller should be an umbrella stroller you will gate check that your book bag is your diaper bag in that you have plenty of diapers wipes formula if you formula feed snacks for your toddler an empty sippy cup for your toddler you will buy juice milk after you get through security few small toys and an extra outfit for everyone including yourself the airline will offer you to be the first to board the plane no you want to be the last to board the plane you do want to make your 18 month old sit on the plane for second longer than necessary let her play and run around in corner while you wait to board then after at the last boarding call get on the plane put the toddler in her seat and have on hand tablet with movie baggie of her favorite snacks cup of her favorite drink and her favorite lovie and blanket if all goes well she will fall asleep your five month old is far easier all you need to do is keep her in her carrier making the assumption you purchased two seats for this flight and the baby will be sitting with you and feed her at take off and landing plus whenever she gets hungry in between if she gets to sleep on you presume she will be happy camper ideally your toddler will sleep for large portion of the flight but let be honest she wo sleep for the whole thing and she wo want to sit still for even hour of awake time so do be afraid to take walk up and down the aisle every once in while to let her boredom out do be afraid to buy few drinks during the flight for yourself as well good luck stash some amp ms or lollipop for the landing the last time flew with kids was when my oldest was 18mo we spent the entire time sitting on the ground by the bathrooms the flight attendants were very nice the descent was the hardest part because he was irritable and uncomfortable so having the candy was special treat bring at least couple thin blankets one to line the carseat in case the 5mo has poop explosion or vomits another for the 18mo should she want to sleep across the seats also bring change of clothes for you wear dress or tunic with leggings so you can easily change your top if it gets barfed on honestly also ask your pediatrician if there is sedative you could give the 18mo if needed my 4yo has sometimes severe eczema and the allergist gave me sedating antihistamine can give at night if he stays awake scratching know ll get flamed for this but my point is it might be an option of course you know your kids best and maybe they do freak out like mine do when tired uncomfortable do you have small tablet or smart phone you can load interactive kids books so when the toddler touches things they move explode etc heck you could probably work on her fruit ninja skills or toddler lock alternately you can take videos of her then play them back or just put the camera on so it like mirror toddlers love themselves also read tip somewhere to bring roll of blue painting tape it very sensory and fun for toddlers plus the toddler can roll it chase it in the airport definitely check with the doctor about dosage for dramamine specifically because the side effects are drowsiness overall think it would be healthier to give my kid the proper amount of something that will help them sleep rather than have them up all night on plane so guess we ll suffer the down votes together vote having backup plan that includes drugs make sure you book bassinet seat for the infant it huge help having somewhere to put her during the flight call now they book up quickly then she should be fine the airplane noise will help her sleep mine just hit cycle of sleep nurse play with toy sleep nurse play with toy also preferred changing her diapers while in the bassinet vs wrangling with the tiny airplane bathroom the toddler will need lot of entertainment get her used to headphones now so she can watch movies cartoons ipad during the flight get bunch of never before seen toys sheets of stickers new coloring book new large triangle shaped crayons the tiny ones will roll around and disappear and new ipad games almost anything by sagosago is great for that age especially forest flyer ocean swimmer space explorer endless alphabet is also favorite tons of snacks that are usually forbidden like mini wrapped chocolates and cookies healthier snacks like boxes of raisins fruit bars crackers etc and their favorite water bottle also try to board super early and talk to stewardess about needing an extra pair of hands during the flight like when you have to go to the bathroom or change one diaper while someone watches the other kid also maybe clearing your food tray asap or just giving you the individual dishes so you re not trapped or deal with balancing baby on your lap while not knocking anything over pack small medical kit for sanity thermometer tylenol saline nasal spray booger sucker diaper rash cream pack two extra onesies and two extra sets of clothes always bring diaper for every hours but have never come close to needing that many it also the only time use sanitizing hand gel like madwoman oh and when you pack use small rolling case for the emergency long term stuff like extra clothes extra diapers big stash of snacks and emergency kits then large purse to keep at your feet for things to have at hand couple diapers sanitizer small snack if you put everything up top it ll be huge pain getting it up and down and finding somewhere to open it and dig for stuff have the toddler carry her own little backpack with her lovey some stickers and pens and snacks even if she does carry it it will help compartmentalize the stuff so you are hunting in the dark source two kids and regularly take 16 hour flights there is nowhere on this earth that want to go that badly good luck this was amazing advice do have two kids yet and not sure about traveling but am saving this info fir if ever do if you re worried about motion sickness sit near the middle of the plane it will experience the least amount of movement also pack your carry on as though you are stranded for 24 hours 10 diapers for each kid wipes change of clothes for everyone and large ziplock bags airports do not carry diapers yeah it took lot of convincing from my mother my brother is getting married and she really wants me to be there if anyone feels like helping me too will be traveling with mon old and yr 1mon old in may am worried about making it to the gate with car seats stroller baby in carrier suitcase backpack diaper bag then wrangling kiddos on actual plane so question is rent carseats from random rental car agency or bring own and do what heard gate checking is best or how do you keep them from being damaged ca afford new ones if they break edit is keeping yr old in car seat on the plane actually better than letting him sit in seat and color on the tray table or something second this as frequent traveller with my yo and 1yo times year often fly alone with them and it would suck without their seats to keep them in it somewhere familiar to them and keeps them from trying to escape into the cabin not to mention it safer and keeps my arms and lap free very good tip thank you we cloth diaper but will be taking bunch of disposables for travel definitely not dealing with cloth diapers on plane lol this is great advice extra set of clothes for all of you and took my month old on flight and he ended up angry and teething so bring something just in case it starts asking for help ahead of time so you can pee is crucial dollar store toys are great electronics are your friend get the kid hooked on an ipad and you are good for awhile sadly 18 months is too young for movies usually but games are good tocaboca also has good games and disneyjr app good luck try to think about flying solo as bad but finite at least you know that the flight ends at certain time good luck thank you so much for your reply nice and detailed fantastic point about the headphones did even think of that going to order some toddler headphones on amazon right now and get her used to them and called the airline about bassinet seats chose bassinet seat on the seat select but they told me that it not guaranteed and the younger the baby is the higher priority it has so figure at least my baby baby will get one my toddler actually got cute little backpack for xmas so ll be sure to pack that with some fun things for her to play with starting to think this is doable thank you fantastic idea to bring lollipops it ll help her ears on the descent too bet also your outfit suggestion for me is exactly what planning found great tunic type shirt that will make breastfeeding super easy to access hope sitting by someone who is squicked out by all that but ll be as discrete as can hahah they definitely do love looking at themselves very good idea to put the tablet on mirror mode she would love that thank you for your suggestions writing list of all these tips love the last tip especially but ca because still breastfeeding thank you so much for your tips yeah just getting them passport photos was struggle lol thanks am sure you have in worse though second the advice about the dollar store toys they helped us so much last time with then 19 mon old we got some crayons pad of paper some cars tic tac toe game he like spinning the options not actually playing it we also had mini magna doodle in case crayons got lost he could still color lots of snacks the 18 month old will have her own seat and hopefully the baby will have bassinet seat if all goes to plan should bring the 18 month olds car seat was planning on it as did want to have to lug it through security and all that hoping she will be able to fall asleep fine just in the airplane seat will look at the dollar store for things that she wo just throw around she in the throwing stage right now not sure about the states but in canada you can bring liquids through security as long as they are for child under so you can have stuff in the dippy cup already too bad she ca fly with you and help you can drink and breastfeed just do get drunk rule of thumb is that if you could drive you can feed no need to pump and dump or anything like that so long as you feel sober you are fine to feed regardless breastfeeding will be very useful during your flight you wo need to carry bottles or formula on the plane and you can feed easily during takeoff and landing that may very well be the case but if it is something can easily get after security like milk water or juice just buy it after so as not to deal with the tsa they tend to be hassle and not know all of their own rules so just would bother with trying to bring liquids unless it was breastmilk or formula or some other special liquid just less stressful in my opinion ooh also mine loved to hold books too so we had couple different books with us think touch and feel one one with animals or whatever they are interested in recently went on an hour plane ride with my 15 month old was so stressed about it and he was amazing we had night flight on the way there and he slept almost the whole time my main concern was my day time flight on the way home had an abundance of snacks including few new things he had never tried with ingredients knew he was allergic to bought few new toys and books that he had never seen before also brought my ipad which he is never allowed to use as last resort it was god send downloaded few movies and it held his attention for long while again it not something he ever allowed to do so that was big treat and lifesaver as far as getting around the airport my ergo carrier was so handy had our passports in the front pocket so they were easy to get to good luck with your travelling sure it will go much better than your imagining it to the airports visited few months ago did have diapers but it was only in little individual travel packs with like diapers and small pack of wipes and expensive obviously speaking of diapers on plane none of the planes we ve been on with my daughter had changing tables in the bathrooms sucked flew lot with my daughter when she was itty breastfeeding on take off and landing helped with the pressure changes second running the toddler ragged before boarding after take off hopefully the white noise will knock her out also tons of good vibes coming your way you can do this you wo need it at the other end the carseat is good because they are hopefully used to staying put in the car especially with shoulder harnesses just lap belt allows toddler to wiggle around lot honestly just risk checking the carseats at the check in counter rather than try to lug all that through security and on to the plane probably would use rental carseats ve never had mine broken but that pretty useless anecdata it only takes one broken carseat as said above prefer toddlers in carseats if possible the carseat is good because they are hopefully used to staying put in the car especially with shoulder harnesses just lap belt allows toddler to wiggle around lot was sure if convenience of checking seats immediately or having toddler strapped down on the plan in harness would be better can always check the infant seat and somehow bring the toddler seat maybe borrow one of the roller things for carseats and ditch the stroller if you can manage it would bring the car seat it is of course safer but also provides more reliable way of keeping your 18 month old in her seat than the the lap seat belt that she ll probably be able to squirm out of this is particularly important for you since you ll have your hands full with the infant think that exactly what do if you ca swing the roller thing for carseats ve never had one that could borrow you can usually jerry rig something where you can use the top tether and or latch straps on the carseat to tie it to your roller suitcase and drag them both together good luck just thought some many airlines will not permit one adult to travel alone with two lap sized children even if one child is in seat would it be worth emailing to be sure think there is now an faa approved harness for flights it supposedly is quite light and rolls up it is supposed to be as good safe as car seat keeps kids in place and weighs less than pound came across this while ago and do have all the details since my kid is too young for it so this comment could be entirely unhelpful but it might be an option if you want to check the car seats but have the safety of it think it was about 60 70 dollars you ca fly with two lap babies so in the second seat bring on your car seat for the 18mth old she will be much more comfortable in her car seat my son slept every flight with his seat and ll never fly without it again dear god yes bring the car seat not only because it safer but you re really going to need to strap her down if she gets unruly especially since you have baby to tend to would not count on her staying put on her own this ^^^ everything about this is truth good luck if you are flying united they no longer allow families with little children to board first other airlines still do though this is excellent advice and will emphasize that the ideal snacks are the ones that are time consuming to eat like cheerios or little crackers if either of them uses pacifier clip it to their clothes once stuff drops on the plane it is such pain to find and pick up again ve seen little forgive us our sins in advance baggies with earplugs that families have handed out to seatmates in your case maybe that more stuff to carry which is the last thing you need however you might consider some candy for the flight attendants hear they adore bribes amp small gestures like that all of what was said above load tablet with movies and games sure she will sleep but that tablet will be lifesaver we regulate screen time in our home but the time we flew the kiddo all that went out the window you can totally have drink whiile nursing maybe try not to nurse and drink at the same time ve got the stink eye from nosey nelly for doing that before hand out little care packages to the other passengers earplugs and treat get anxious when disturb others this makes me feel little more calm also try to have no expectations of things going smoothly try to accept that it going to be difficult think of it as an adventure hey flight attendant and mama here if you know which airline you are travelling with maybe can help you look up the rules for travel and help you troubleshoot deleted my husband and just got tsa pre check you pay 85 for background check and then you get to go to the tsa pre check line which is fast no waiting and you do have to take off shoes or coats or take laptops out of your bag etc it lasts for yrs believe you can fill out the info at the airport and get finger printed at least month before your needed flight results are online as soon as week after though or there are some standalone offices what did it is awesome just traveled solo with my yr old and mo old and security was breeze because of it worth every penny http www tsa gov tsa precheck as someone that regularly has boobs at the ready on flights have no shame air new zealand have traveled with them with kids yet but every time ve been on my own they ve been fantastic very interesting thank you so much when booked the tickets it did say that you ca travel with two lap sized children unless you book one seat which of course would do lol but think will double check on that no my mum runs daycare and has many car seats so wo need it but definitely considering it to keep her in properly its just that her car seat is very big dread lugging it thru the airport not to mention the relaxing benefits of drink to help stay calm what about portable booster seat https www amazon com dp b00csawioq ref=cm sw awd hzcrub0y12td0 instead could strap it to the seat and kiddo could be strapped down with tray to play on you need to bring carseat or cares device kiwihousewife |if you are the only adult travelling with more than one infant you will need to reserve seat for the additional infant and pay child fare **the additional infant must be restrained in an approved infant car seat which you must provide an alternative to using car seat inflight is the cares child restraint system ** cares has been approved for use on air new zealand flights by the new zealand caa direct link to air new zealand traveling with infant policies http www airnewzealand co nz infants car seats hahahaahaha what month old an 18 month old diaper bag and **a carseat** nope researched the cares device for you http kidsflysafe com buy now how much does your daughter weigh if she over 22lbs you can use the cares device you wo have to carry carseat it will fit in your carry on you can keep you 18 month old still and safe for the critical phases of flight turbulence which is required by air new zealand and most international airlines it 75 pro tips for getting the best help from airline crew check in agents gate agents and cabin crew seldom if ever see someone travelling alone with two infants you can do it supermom the more you can communicate your situation in advance the better give the airline heads up in advance https airnz custhelp com app answers detail id 981 53 by calling air new zealand http www airnewzealand co nz phone numbers explain that you are travelling with two infants and ask that the make note on the passenger manifest mention if you are bringing cares device or carseat they can give you any salient information before the flight you ll feel more relaxed knowing that you ve touched base with air new zealand if they can make note on the passenger manifest the flight crew will already know that you are travelling with two infants this is important you want the flight attendants to be your helpful friends catching them unawares with two infants might send them running to their flight attendant manuals to figure out the rules here ensuring that you can in fact have both little ones under your care also it gives the crew chance to talk about carseats or the cares device before the flight meaning they can better help you **talk to the gate agents before boarding starts ** you ve gotten through security you ve found your gate and you are ready to board before boarding starts swing by the desk and introduce yourself the gate agents can give the flight crew the heads up that you have your two little ones the advance notice will have the crew ready to help **pre board know that the top post here recommends boarding last** and you know what travelling with child aged 3+ agree with this do it all the time myself but quite frankly waiting until the last minute to board is going to stress out your flight attendants for children under two we must give you briefing on time performance is so important and flight attendants are not paid until the doors close showing up at the last minute and needing to set up car seat cares device settle in receive briefing is lot of time and it risks delaying the flight even 5minute delay causes the flight to lose it place in queue for takeoff **please do not board last you have two infants and you need the time to settle in you ll feel so much more relaxed** and you ll have chance to make friends with the flight attendants usually they have fold down tray over the toilet seat for changing but it not always marked well most importantly you can do this seriously you can you do need any advice from me or anybody because when it comes down to it you ll probably put on your mom hat roll with the punches have great time at your destination and have an awesome story for later in case you want any more ideas here are two links to my youtube channel where vlogged about this topic tips for flying with toddler https www youtube com watch v=rmq1vcj68 amp list=uuhgroo8egxnpt7qvhjn6gcg and carry on bag tips from flight attendant for flying with an infant https www youtube com watch v=ax hl6gxyq0 amp list=uuhgroo8egxnpt7qvhjn6gcg top things tell fellow parents travelling with infants **do worry about what people think ** most people in the world have been are parents they get it they empathize they want you to be comfortable and are silently rooting for you people love to bitch about any travel inconveniences as if it some huge ordeal but seriously think about your own experience sure you ve complained about baby after the flight but during the flight felt sympathy towards the parents right **babies love flying ** seriously ve only once knowing child to cry all flight 99 of infants babies are smiling contented and chill the soothing white noise of the engine and bumps of flight are like being in the womb **babies just hate take off and landing** because they have to be held in the burping position or otherwise restrained it sucks for them also their little ears hurt **the best way know of for babies to clear their ears is for them to cry ** us adults we yawn chew gum sip drink laugh blow our nose shake our heads ha we do all kinds of things to alleviate the sinus pressure of altitude infants ca they can help themselves by crying do feel apologetic about it let em cry it ll clear their ears and then your girls can enjoy themselves know you can drink and breastfeed but can you imagine all of the evil glares you would get on plane full of people who most likely think you need to pump and dump makes me giggle cares device is 75 http kidsflysafe com buy now ask your mom to buy it for you since she wants you to come out so badly haha you wo have to carry your carseat two girls carry on it fits in your carry on you must bring carseat or cares device to fly air new zealand http www airnewzealand ca infants car seats so the cares device will be hell of lot easier for you source am flight attendant and mama this is my favourite string of advice in the whole thread albeaner should have blog on real mom advice people can be as perfect parents as they like day to day but desperate times call for desperate measures and little screen time and sweets to distract are going to go long way to make your day easier plus dose of tyelnol will pre emptively help with the ear pressure hope this insight will help flight attendant and mama **re gate checking ** when you gate check your car seat will be hand carried from the bridge to the hold one individual person will make that short walk down the stairs and directly to the plane your carseats wo have to go through all kinds of baggage adventure in the airport **carseat on board or gatechecked for your two year old ** |is keeping yr old in car seat on the plane actually better than letting him sit in seat and color on the tray table or something ** here an idea for you you could bring your carseat to keep him still for take off turbulence landing but let him out to play colour be happy on the plane on your laps flew with my 20month old on my lap for 5hrs and no extra seat you know what it worked surprisingly well spent an hour typing editing formatting advice for flying with toddler in this thread check it out some of it might be helpful for you you can do it not on these planes we were on in varying sizes and flight attendants confirmed they did have them after our searches were fruitless super sucked your 18 month old should be allowed to have her own bag as well not 100 sure on the airlines rules for carry on bags but ca see them denying her small backpack maybe fill up this bag with new cheap toys and change of clothes for her save it all for the trip mine all liked to have their own bag for treasures wish you luck on your trip definitely recommend bringing the car seat as someone else noted your kiddo is used to sitting still in car seat so it will probably make for an easier flight at least that was my experience when flew with my two small kids last year to transport it across the airport attached it to stroller with bungee cord strollers do count as carry on item yay which was nice because then also had device for transporting all the other carry on stuff the one upside to lugging two kids and all the paraphernalia through the airport is that security will take one look at you and send you on the fast track through the scanners rock it just flew hours with year old and month old and we had planned on taking the toddlers car seat as he had his own seat and we thought it would make him more comfortable we even squeezed the seat down the aisle and wrangled it into his airplane seat sat down and promptly gate checked his car seat do know who you re flying with but those seats are narrow and when my toddler got squirmy it was helpful for him to have more room to wiggle in his seat this was super key for us god you are super woman good luck love your tone was half expecting to find directions to bomb that someone must then defuse by following your instructions just wink at everyone lol will give it go checked the size of the seats and it says 17 inches argh so narrow her carseat is tiny bit wider than that but it be great if can squeeze it in do you think she will be able to sleep okay with the cares device since we have bassinet seating the arm chairs do lift on those seats so she wo be able to lean on me to sleep so worry that she wo be able to sleep sitting up with only the harness also measured her car seat could figure out if it was airline approved or not an it about inch wider than the seating chart shows the seat is as an air hostess thought you may know if its possible to still squish it in do want to buy new car seat very very helpful thank you will definitely keep number in mind you are infinitely helpful ours also fit but it placed her feet in perfect kicking distance of the seat in front of hers and made my seat feel more cramped that why we opted to checkit for long flight having comfortable place for her to sleep is ideal but when she up that space will be pretty unusable as she ll be wanting new position or stir crazy with her seat hope your family appreciates your effort to get to the wedding and offer you plenty of free child care when you arrive so you can decompress and then gear up for the return flight wonder if regular older child booster seat would work on long flight it would need to be appropriate for the road since your mom has that covered feel like they tend to be little lighter and more bare bones it give your toddler safe place to sleep but also might be small enough to be tucked into an overhead bin if you decide you do need it during certain parts of the flight actually drinking while nursing is the best way to do it because the alcohol has the most amount of time to get out of your system before the next nurse drink up mama the other passengers do care what you do as long as you are trying if anyone says anything at all to you just say maybe you like to give me hand then and hand them book to read to your toddler it like it not reasonable to expect families to drive these long distances so you have to fly so people have to deal with the realities of children it not library hang in there mom suggest that every hours you take ten minutes to yourself and just totally ignore your kids even if they are screaming their heads off and then jump back in the ring
